Description: Fragment from belly-shoulder zone of large pottery vessel (krater?); interior reserved; exterior, white slip; friezes separated by bands with added red band lined in white; above, goats (part of two preserved; added red on haunch) processing left; trace of back of animal in lower frieze.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 220, no. 70)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 111, pl. XXXIV, no. 321.10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.492)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4657 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
